page.title: 01Chiltern Slopes
page.content: This rural area is in Buckinghamshire and lies on the southern part of the Chiltern Hills, most of it is over 300 feet above sea level. To the S.W. and N.E. the hills rise to over 600 feet. The area is bisected by a deepish narrow valley. The centre lies some eight miles from the towns of Henley and High Wycombe, whilst somewhat nearer is the riverside town of Marlow. About a quarter of the area is densely wooded, much of it beech. In reafforestation conifers are planted as hosts to newly planted beech. The villages of Turville, Fingest and Skirmett are in the valley, whilst Frieth is on a small plateau, over 500 feet above sea level, to the S.E. An intermittent stream, rising in the area of Skirmett, flows south down the valley to the River Thames.
